data.profileText: a Representative from North Carolina; born in Bertie County, N.C., October 15, 1779; graduated from Princeton College in 1797; member of the North Carolina state house of commons in 1802, 1803, and 1811; presidential elector on the Madison ticket in 1812; member of the North Carolina state senate 1812-1814; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Fourteenth Congress (March 4, 1815-March 3, 1817); appointed chief clerk of the Navy Department by Secretary Branch and served from 1829 to 1831; died in Tarboro, Edgecomb County, N.C., December 20, 1843.
